timeline.bodyText: This is not introduced by this PR but: the fields can be declared final?
timeline.author: guozhangwang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -18,6 +18,10 @@
 
 import java.util.Optional;
 
+/**
+ * A metadata struct containing the consumer group information.
+ * Note: Any change to this class is considered public and requires a KIP.
+ */

timeline.bodyText: Why we want to return a clone of the groupMetadata? If we can declare all the fields as final, and whenever we update we always create a new ConsumerGroupMetadata object, then I think we can safely return the cached object directly.
timeline.author: guozhangwang

replies.bodyText: Good point, I think we probably don't need to have this.
replies.author: abbccdda

timeline.bodyText: Since this callback is not synchronized and nor does the getter groupMetadata(), we should declare this cached object volatile.
timeline.author: guozhangwang

replies.bodyText: For normal consumer user, this callback should be executed on the same thread of the caller right? Why do we need to make it volatile?
replies.author: abbccdda

replies.bodyText: Well I was thinking two threads could be two threads, one calling consumer.groupMetadata and one calling consumer.poll which is creating a new object, but on a second thought this race condition maybe fine anyways since we cannot guarantee time-ordering if it happens.
replies.author: guozhangwang

timeline.message: remove copy constructor and make fields final
